messages.subject: I'm a NERVOUS WRECK!!!  ACK!!!
messages.msgSnippet: THAT S IT, THAT S IT!!!  ***Dinosaur Valley State Park @ Glen Rose/Cleburne*** thanks SO MUCH, Carron and this is perfect timing, thanks!!! I wanted to tell
messages.messageBody:
THAT'S IT, THAT'S IT!!! ***Dinosaur Valley State Park @ Glen
Rose/Cleburne*** thanks SO MUCH, Carron and this is perfect timing,
thanks!!!

I wanted to tell you all to take care and have fun w/ your chatter :)
we're leaving for Dallas first thing in the morning (IF NOT EARLIER) b/c dd
is in the early stages of LABOR!!! YIPPIE but I'm a NeRvOuS WrEcK!!! dd
was going to be induced Thurs am but her dr told her today she doesn't think
she'll last that long, so we're going earlier than we'd planned!!! I
reminded dd that I labored w/ her only 4 hrs and ds #2's labor was a total
of 45 mins ~> so, we're all keeping our fingers crossed, hoping and praying
the expression *like mother/like daughter* will hold true THIS TIME, too!!!
<VBG>

Pris ~> *signing off* for a few while ~~>> next time I post I'll be either
Kinsey *Gramby* or Sam's *Gramby* <SMILES> :)) take care ...
WARNING: I cannot be help responsible for the above, as apparently my cats
have learned how to type ...




----- Original Message -----
From: <Cararmst@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com>
Sent: Friday, September 08, 2000 4:07 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] it won't be pretty but Pris is doing RAIN
DANCES!!!
>
> In a message dated 9/7/2000 11:52:22 PM Central Daylight Time,
> x_t_sipr@... writes:
>
>
> > btw ... since you are a Dallasonian do you know the name of the
park/area
> > that has the dinosaur tracks located near Dallas??? we wanted to see
this
> > next week but for the LIFE OF ME, I don't recall the name??? tia :)
>
> Sure, you're talking about Dinosaur Valley State Park -- it's near Glen
Rose,
> south of Cleburne. You can get some information on the park and
directions
> to it from the Texas Parks and Rec website: www.tpwd.state.tx.us. It is
> pretty awesome to go down in the river bed and actually walk in the
footsteps
> of dinosaurs. Also in that area is the Rossil Rim Wildlife Center, a
drive
> through wild animal park where you get to feed the animals from your car.
We
> really like it there. Try www.fossilrim.com. But, that's all about 1 to
1
> 1/2 hours south of here.
>
> Good luck Grandma!!
>
> Carron
